The inlet 210a communicates with the pulp feed tank 85 for supplying the pulp suspension PS.

Of the upright gate members 212a, 212b, 212c provided in the main body frame 80, the gate member forming partition of upward and downward direction of the flow passage 210, that is, the upper end edge of the gate member 212a in the preferred embodiment is set to be lower than the water level (horizontal line H in Fig. 27A) of the pulp suspension PS flowing and staying on the flat member 211 as described below.

Near the inlet 210a of the flow passage 210, a partition plate 214 is provided so as to partition the flow passage 210, and a plurality of communication holes 214a, 214a, ... are opened in this partition plate 214 at specific intervals as shown in Fig. 27B.
The flat member 211 is provided at the side of exit 210b of the flow passage 210, and is covering the mesh cells of the mesh endless belt 45 in closed state from the upper side.

The partition member 79 has a draining louver structure composed of a plurality of framework members 79a, 79a, ... same as in preferred embodiment 1, and has the shape and size for slidably supporting the entire width of the downside of the mesh endless belt 45, while the flat member 82 in preferred embodiment 1 is omitted.

At the leading end edge of the flat member 211, a thin guide sheet 215 is provided for assuring a smooth flow of pulp suspension onto the mesh endless belt 45. The leading end edge 215a of the guide sheet 215 is set at a position corresponding to one of the gate for forming the louver structure of the partition member 79, that is, the framework members 79a, 79a, ... (the final gate 79a in this preferred embodiment), and specifically it is slidably disposed at the upside position of the mesh endless belt 45 supported by the gate 79a.

When the pulp suspension PS is supplied from the pulp feed tank 85 into the flow passage 210 in the paper making frame 78 through the inlet 210a, it slowly flows through the meandering flow passage 210 as indicated by arrows in Fig. 27A and Fig. 27B, and flows and stays on the flat member 211 from the outlet 210b, and is hence uniformly diffused and supplied on the upside of the running mesh endless belt 45 disposed in upward inclination toward the running direction.

The action and effect of the flow passage structure of pulp suspension PS in this pulp feed unit 47 may be estimated as follows. (i) Presence of partition plate 214 having a plurality of communication holes 214a, 214a, ...The partition plate 214 is provided to partition the flow passage 210, and a plurality of communication holes 214a, 214a, ... are opened in this partition plate 214, and hence the pulp suspension PS supplied from the pulp feed tank 85 passes through the plurality of communication holes 214a, 214a, ... of this partition 214, and is diffused in the entire flow passage 210, and is adjusted so that the flow rate may be uniform in the entire opening of the section of the flow passage.
description.heading: (ii) Meandering route of flow passage 210
description.p: The flow passage 210 divided and formed by the gate members 212 (212a, 212b, 212c) is meandering and long, and the pulp suspension PS passes through this flow passage 210, and is diffused uniformly.
description.heading: (iii) Height of upper end edge of gate member 212a
description.p: In the flow passage 210, the height of upper end edge of the gate member 212a forming the partition at the turning point from upward to downward direction is set to be lower than the water level H of the pulp suspension PS flowing and staying on the flat member 211 as shown in Fig. 27A, so that pulsation of water level of pulp suspension PS can be effectively prevented.

When the height of upper end edge of the gate member 212a is very close to the water level H of the pulp suspension Ps (lower than water level H by 1 o 2 mm), the pulp suspension PS is filtered by the net of the net of the mesh endless belt 45, and the water level H is lowered, and a time lag occurs until the pulp suspension PS supplied in the flow passage 210 from the lower part of the inlet 210a rides over the gate member 212a, and the water level H pulsates, and lateral creases may be formed in the matrix of the recycled paper RP.

By contrast, in the illustrated preferred embodiment, since the height of the upper end edge of the gate member 212a is set to be lower than the water level H, and such troubles are avoided effectively.
description.heading: (iv) Thin guide sheet 215 at the leading end edge of flat member 211
description.p: Since the leading end edge 215a of the guide sheet 215 is slidably disposed at the upside position of mesh endless belt 45 supported by the gate 79a forming the louver structure of the partition member 79, uniform filtering performance is assured by the net of the mesh endless belt 45.

Located between the gates 79a and 79a of the partition member 79, the pulp suspension PS tends to flow freely also in the direction of follower roller 66 when filtered by the net of the mesh endless belt 45, and hence uniform filtering by the net is difficult, and uneven filtering may occur locally. When filtering is not uniform, vertical creases may be formed in the matrix of the recycled paper RP.

By contrast, in the illustrated preferred embodiment, since the upper end edge 215 of the guide sheet 215 is set at upside position of the gate 79a for forming the louver structure of the partition member 79, such troubles are avoided effectively.

The dewatering roll 41 of the paper making section 3 is designed to roll and squeeze the both belts 45 and 95 from upper and lower sides in pressed state, at the upper and lower adjacent engaging portions of the smooth surface endless belt 95 of the drying belt conveyor 42 at the downstream side and the mesh endless belt 45 of the paper making net conveyor 40 at the upstream side, and in the preferred embodiment, two sets of dewatering roll 70 and press roll 71 in preferred embodiment 1 are provided continuously. The main squeezing function is realized by the set of dewatering roll 70 and press roll 71 at the upstream side, while the set of dewatering roll 70 and press roll 71 at the downstream side plays a supporting squeezing action. Due to such difference in purpose, the upstream side dewatering roll 70 is provided with drain roll 180 same as in preferred embodiment 8.

In the drying belt conveyor 42 of the paper making section 3, a crease preventive endless belt 220 is rotatably suspended and supported in the plurality of smooth surface finishing rolls 103, 103,... in preferred embodiment 1 . In the shown preferred embodiment, four smooth surface finishing rolls 103, 103, ... are provided, but the number of smooth surface finishing rolls 103 may be properly increased or decreased according to the purpose.

The crease preventive endless belt 220 is designed to maintain the smoothness by preventing creasing of the wet paper RPO by applying a tension while pressing the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95 from the upper side.

Specifically, the running speed of the crease preventive endless belt 220 is set larger than the running speed of the smooth surface endless belt 95, and tension is applied to the wet paper RPO due to difference in speed of the two bets 220, 95.

The crease preventive endless belt 220 is made of a permeable material capable of passing and dissipating moisture and steam remaining inside the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95, and the belt is preferably formed of felt belt, mesh belt having fine mesh cells, or mesh base material having fine mesh cells coated with a felt material, and a felt belt is used in the illustrated preferred embodiment.
Instead of the smooth surface finishing roll 103, a smooth surface finishing roll 123 of preferred embodiment 8 having a built-in heater and functioning as heating roll may be used.

At the terminal end of the drying belt conveyor 42, the size cutter 221 of the preferred embodiment cuts the recycled paper RP separated from the smooth endless belt 95 not only in specified length as in preferred embodiment 1, but also in specified length to cut in a specified rectangular shape. Specifically, the size cutter 221 has a composite structure composed of a roll slitter 221 a for cutting the recycled paper RP in specified width, and a guillotine cutter 221 b for cutting the recycle paper RP in specified length, and these cutters are driven by a drive motor 221 c.
Other structure and operation are same as in preferred embodiment 1.
description.heading: Preferred Embodiment 10
description.p: This preferred embodiment is shown in Fig. 28 to Fig. 32, and is similar to preferred embodiment 9, except that the used paper recycling apparatus 1 is slightly modified.

In the used paper recycling apparatus 1 of the preferred embodiment, the structure of the pulp feed unit 47 of the paper making section 3 is modified, and the heating and drying unit 97 of the drying belt conveyor 42 is provided with a steam collection unit 250 for collecting steam generated by heating and drying. The components modified from preferred embodiment 9 are specifically described below.
description.heading: III. Paper making section 3
description.p: In the paper making net conveyor 40 of the paper making section 3, specific structure of pulp feed unit 47 is as shown in Fig. 31A and Fig. 31B, in which the mesh endless belt 45 is disposed in upward inclination toward the running direction same as in preferred embodiment 9, and paper making frame 78 and partition member 79 are disposed at upper and lower positions of the mesh endless belt 45.

The paper making frame 78 is disposed slidably on the upside of the mesh endless belt 45, and includes a main body frame 80, a flow passage 210 provided inside of the main body frame 80, and a flat member 251 disposed near the exit side of the flow passage 210.

Specifically, in the structure of paper making frame 78 in preferred embodiment 8 (see Fig. 27A and Fig. 27B), the flat member 251 is attached and fixed to the flat member 211 so that the inclination may be downward by way of the support plate 252.

Referring to Fig. 31A and Fig. 31B, for example, if only the plate member 211 of upward slope is provided same as in preferred embodiment 8, without having flat member 251, the pulp suspension PS supplied in the paper making frame 78 from the pulp feed tank 85 passes through the flow passage 210, and flows onto the flat member 211 from its outlet 210b, and since the flat member 211 has an upward slope, the pulp suspension PS climbs up the flat member 211. The pulp suspension PS climbing up the flat member 211 may be disturbed in flow, and such turbulent flow in the pulp suspension PS staying on the flat member 211 may have adverse effects on the matrix of the recycled paper RP manufactured by the mesh endless belt 45.

In consideration of this point, in the preferred embodiment, a flat member 251 of downward slope is provided, and the pulp suspension PS flowing from the outlet 210b of the flow passage 210 onto the flat member 211 flows down smoothly on the upside of the flat member 251, and turbulent flow is prevented securely, so that the matrix of the recycled paper RP may be further enhanced.

The steam collection unit 250 provided in the heating and drying unit 97 of the drying belt conveyor 42 is mainly composed of a steam collection chamber 252 formed in part of the cover of the apparatus case 5, that is, decorative case cover 5a, as shown in Fig. 32, and an exhaust fan 253 for exhausting the steam collection chamber 252.

Specifically, as shown in Fig. 32, an exhaust duct 254 is extending from the steam collection chamber 252 to the ceiling of the white water collect tank 15 of the water feed device 9 along the inner side of the decorative case cover 5a, and is opposite to the white water collect tank 15 from the upside. The exhaust fan 253 is provided horizontally downward in the exhaust port 254a of the exhaust duct 254.

The mounting position of the exhaust fan 253 is not limited to the preferred embodiment, but may be provided at the air intake side of the exhaust duct 254, or other proper position capable of exhausting the steam collection chamber 252.

In the heating and drying unit 97, the steam generated by heating and drying action is first collected in the steam collection chamber 25 by the exhaust action of the exhaust fan 253 as indicated by arrow in Fig. 32, and is circulated to return to the white water collect tank 15 through the exhaust duct 254.

In this case, the steam generated to fill in the steam collection chamber 252 is very hot, and although not shown specifically, by changing the mounting position of the exhaust fan 253 or exhaust direction, the reflux passage of the steam may by intersected with the dropping collection route of the white water W filtered and dewatered in the paper making section 3 into the white water collect tank 15, and the cooling effect of the white water W may be utilized.
Other structure and operation are same as in preferred embodiment 1.
description.heading: Preferred Embodiment 11
description.p: This preferred embodiment is shown in Fig. 33, and is similar to preferred embodiment 1, except that the used paper recycling apparatus 1 is slightly modified.

In the used paper recycling apparatus 1 of the preferred embodiment, a shredder 260 is provided at the inlet 10a of the agitating tank 10 of the pulp making section 2. The shredder 260 is intended to enhance the efficiency of macerating and mashing by the agitating device 8 by preliminarily shredding the used paper UP, UP, ... charged into the inlet 10a into small pieces.

The specific structure of the shredder 260 is same as that of the conventional shredder, having functions of cutting used paper UP into small pieces, and the cutting size by the shredding mechanism is designed to satisfy the following condition.

That is, the conventional shredder is designed to cut into a very small size in order to prevent leak of confidential information or private information of the printed characters and patterns effectively by shredding the used paper until the printed characters and patterns are not legible, but the main purpose of shredder 260 of the preferred embodiment is to assist the operation of the apparatus by cutting the used paper pulp UPP manufactured from the cut used paper CUP, CUP, ... to a size enough as material pulp for recycled paper RP to be manufactured in the paper making section 3 in next process.

For this purpose, the cutting size of shredding mechanism of the shredder 260 is set to such an extent that the paper fiber of cut used paper CUP is not smaller than the required size as material pulp for recycled paper RP. Therefore, as far as this condition is satisfied, the shredding mechanism may be realized by double cut method, cross cut method, and any other method selectively.

When used paper UP is charged from the inlet 10a, the used paper UP is preliminarily cut by the shredder 260 , and cut used paper CUP, CUP, ... of specified size is obtained, and it is agitated for a specified time in the water W supplied from the water feed device 9 by normal and reverse rotation of the agitating impeller 11 of the agitating device 8, and macerated and mashed, and used paper pulp UPP is prepared. The time required for macerating and mashing is shorter than in preferred embodiment 1.
Other structure and operation are same as in preferred embodiment 1.

The foregoing preferred embodiments 1 to 11 are examples showing preferred embodiments of the invention, and the invention is not limited to these preferred embodiments alone, but may be changed and modified within the scope of the true spirit of the invention. The following modified examples are also included in the scope of the invention.
(1) In the foregoing preferred embodiments, the heater plate 109 is used as heating unit of the heating and drying unit 97, and this heater plate 109 may be replaced by rotating heater roll, hot air heater, and other heating means.

Although not shown in the drawing, when the heater roll is used as the heating unit of the heating and drying unit 97, for example, the heater roll is disposed to roll directly on the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95, and the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95 may be directly heated and dried by the heater roll. Alternatively, when the hot air heater is provided as heating unit of the heating and drying unit 97, for example, the hot air heater blows hot air directly to the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95, and the wet paper RPO on the smooth surface endless belt 95 is directly heated and dried by the hot air heater.
(2) The specific processing operation by the control section 4 may be executed, by change of program or the like, after the process executed in preferred embodiment 1 (pulp making process of pulp making section 2 and paper making section by paper making section 3), or the design may be properly changed depending on the purpose or processing capacity.

As the invention may be embodied in several forms without departing from the essential characteristics thereof, the present preferred embodiments are therefore illustrative and not restrictive, since the scope of the invention is defined by the appended claims rather than by the description preceding them.

A used paper recycling apparatus (1) comprising, in an apparatus case (5) of furniture size, a pulp making section (2) for manufacturing used paper pulp by macerating and mashing used paper, a paper making section (3) for manufacturing recycled paper by making the used paper pulp manufactured in the pulp making section, and a control section (4) for driving and controlling the pulp making section (2) and paper making section (3) by interlocking, wherein the pulp making section (2) comprises a macerating unit (6) for macerating the used paper by agitating and tearing, and a mashing unit (7) for mashing the used paper macerated in the macerating unit (6), and
the mashing unit (7) has at least one mashing machine (20), and this mashing machine (20) includes a plurality of mashing members (21, 22) disposed oppositely across a slight mashing clearance and moving relatively, and the opposing faces of these mashing members (21, 22) are both inclined to form a taper shape gradually increasing in diameter toward the mutually opposite directions and cooperate to form a mashing action surface (21 a, 22a), and the used paper passing the mashing clearance is pressurized and mashed by the mashing action surface (21 a, 22a), and the inks forming characters and patterns on the used paper are pulverized.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 1, wherein the mashing machine (20) comprises a mashing tank (23) having a feed port (25) and a discharge port (26) communicating with an agitating tank (10) of the macerating section, the plurality of mashing members (21, 22) disposed relatively movably in this mashing tank (23), and a drive source (24) for relatively moving these mashing members (21, 22), and the used paper pulp supplied into the feed port (25) of the mashing tank (23) from the agitating tank (10) is pressurized and mashed by the mashing action surface (21 a, 22a) while passing the mashing clearance of the mashing members (21, 22), and the inks forming characters and patterns on the used paper are pulverized, and returned back to the agitating tank (10) again from the discharge port (26) of the mashing tank (23).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 2, wherein the mashing section comprises a plurality of mashing machines (150, 160),
the feed port of the mashing machine (150, 160) at the uppermost upstream side communicates with the agitating tank (10) of the macerating section (6), the discharge port (26) of the mashing machine (150, 160) at the lowermost downstream side communicates with the agitating tank (10) of the macerating section (6), and
the mashing machines (150, 160) interposed between the mashing machines (150, 160) at the uppermost upstream side and lowermost downstream side have their feed ports (25) communicating with the discharge ports (26) of the mashing machines (150, 160) adjacent to the upstream side, and their discharge ports (26) communicating with the feed ports (25) of the mashing machines (150, 160) adjacent to the downstream side, and
the used paper pulp supplied into the feed port (25) of the mashing tank (23) at the uppermost upstream side from the agitating tank (10) is pressurized and mashed by the mashing action surface while sequentially passing through the mashing clearances of the consecutive mashing machines (150, 160), and the inks forming characters and patterns on the used paper are pulverized, and returned back to the agitating tank (10) of the macerating section (6) again from the discharge port (26) of the mashing tank (23) at the lowermost downstream side.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the pulp making section (2) is a circulation type in which the used paper pulp circulates between the macerating section (6) and the mashing section (7) in a specified time.
The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one preceding claim, wherein the water used in the pulp making section (2) is the water collected from the paper making section (3) after dewatering.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one preceding claim, wherein the macerating unit (6) of the pulp making section (2) includes agitating means (8) for agitating used paper, and water feed means (9) for supplying water to this agitating means (8), and the used paper supplied from the inlet (10a) of the apparatus case (5) is agitated in water, and macerated and mashed.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 6, wherein the pulp making section (2) is disposed at the downstream side of the agitating tank (10) of the macerating section (6), has pulp concentration adjusting means (35) for adjusting the concentration of the used paper pulp supplied from the agitating tank (10), and
this pulp concentration adjusting means (35) includes a concentration adjusting tank (36) for storing the used paper pulp supplied from the agitating tank (10), and concentration adjusting water feed means for supplying water to this concentration adjusting tank (36), and in the concentration adjusting tank (36), the used paper pulp supplied from the agitating tank (10) is adjusted in concentration by the water added from the concentration adjusting water feed means, and a pulp suspension of specified concentration is produced.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one preceding claim, wherein the paper making section (3) includes a paper making net conveyor (40) for making wet paper from mixed slurry pulp suspension of used paper pulp and water sent from the pulp making section (2), a drying belt conveyor (42) for making recycled paper by drying the wet paper made and formed in the paper making net conveyor (40), and a dewatering roll (41) for compressing and dewatering the wet paper at the junction of the paper making net conveyor (40) and drying belt conveyor (42), and is designed to make paper from the pulp suspension supplied from the pulp making section (2), and dewater and dry.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 8, wherein the paper making net conveyor (40) has a mesh endless belt (45) having a specified width for conveying the pulp suspension while making, a drive motor (46) for moving and driving this mesh endless belt (45), and a pulp feeder (47) for supplying the pulp suspension from the pulp making section (2) onto the mesh endless belt (45), and this pulp feeder (47) distributes and supplies the pulp suspension uniformly on the upper surface of the mesh endless belt (45).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 9, wherein in the pulp feeder (47), the mesh endless belt (45) is disposed obliquely upward toward the running direction, and the pulp feeder (47) has a partition member (79) slidably disposed on the downside of the mesh endless belt (45), and a paper making frame (78) slidably disposed on the upside of the mesh endless belt (45), and the pulp suspension supplied into the paper making frame (78) is uniformly diffused on the upside of the mesh endless belt (45) by the stagnant action by cooperation of the paper making frame (78) and partition member (79), and is conveyed together with the mesh endless belt (45) while maintaining the width dimension defined by the paper making frame (78) by the running action of the mesh endless belt (45), and is dewatered by the gravity filtering action by the mesh cells of the mesh endless belt (45).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 8, 9 or 10, wherein the drying belt conveyor (42) includes a smooth surface endless belt (95) having a specified width for receiving and conveying the wet paper sent from the paper making net conveyor (40), a drive motor (96) for moving and driving the smooth surface endless belt (95), and a heating and drying unit (97) for heating and drying the wet paper on the smooth surface endless belt (95), and at the downstream side position of the dewatering roll (41), the squeezed and dewatered wet paper on the paper making net conveyor (40) is transferred tightly and conveyed to the downside of the smooth surface endless belt (95) by the smooth surface structure of the smooth surface endless belt (95).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one of claims 8 to 11, wherein the dewatering roll (41) rolls and squeezes the mesh endless belt (45) of the paper making net conveyor (40) and the smooth surface endless belt (95) of the drying belt conveyor (42) from upper and lower sides, and squeezes and dewaters the wet paper on the mesh endless belt (45).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 12, wherein the dewatering roll (41) includes a dewatering roll (70) rolling on the mesh endless belt (45) from the lower side, a press roll (71) rolling and pressing the smooth surface endless belt (95) together with the dewatering roll (70) from the upper side, and a drive motor (72) for rotating and driving the two rolls (70, 71) in cooperation, and by these two rolls (70, 71), the mesh endless belt (45) and smooth surface endless belt (95) are rolled and squeezed from upper and lower sides, and the moisture contained in the wet paper on the mesh endless belt (45) is absorbed in the dewatering roll (70) by way of the mesh endless belt (45).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 9, wherein at the upstream side of the dewatering roll (70), a preliminary dewatering roll (74) is disposed to roll on the mesh endless belt (45) from the lower side.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 11, wherein near the upstream side position of the dewatering roll (70), a slurry preventive roll (75) is disposed for rolling and pressing the smooth surface endless belt (95) from the upper side.

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 11, wherein in the midst of running route of the smooth surface endless belt (95), a smooth surface finishing roll (103) is disposed for rolling and pressing the wet paper on the smooth surface endless belt (95).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of claim 11, wherein the heating and drying unit (97) of the drying belt conveyor (42) includes a steam collection unit (250) for collecting the steam generated by heating and drying, and this steam collection unit (250) has a steam collection chamber (252) formed in the cover of the apparatus case (5), and an exhaust fan (253) for exhausting the steam collection chamber (252).

The used paper recycling apparatus (1) of any one of claims 8 to 17, wherein in the paper making section (3), the smooth surface endless belt (95) of the drying belt conveyor (42) and the mesh endless belt (45) of the paper making net conveyor (40) at the upstream side are laminated in upper and lower layers, and in the vertical adjacent parts of the smooth surface endless belt (95) and mesh endless belt (45), the dewatering roll (41) squeezes and rolls on the smooth surface endless belt (95) and mesh endless belt (45) from the upper and lower sides.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1), comprenant, dans une enceinte d'appareil (5) de la taille d'un meuble, une section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) pour fabriquer de la pâte à papier usagé en faisant macérer et en brassant le papier usagé, une section de fabrication de papier (3) pour fabriquer du papier recyclé en fabriquant la pâte à papier usagé fabriquée dans la section de fabrication de pâte à papier, et une section de commande (4) pour entraîner et contrôler la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) et la section de fabrication de papier (3) par verrouillage mutuel, la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) comprenant une unité de macération (6) pour faire macérer le papier usagé par agitation et rupture, et une unité de brassage (7) pour brasser le papier usagé macéré dans l'unité de macération (6) ; et
l'unité de brassage (7) comporte au moins une machine de brassage (20), cette machine de brassage (20) englobant plusieurs éléments de brassage (21, 22) agencés de manière opposée à travers un léger jeu de brassage et effectuant un déplacement relatif, les faces opposées de ces éléments de brasage (21, 22) étant toutes les deux inclinées pour établir une forme en cône, ayant un diamètre progressivement accru vers les directions mutuellement opposées, et coopérant pour former une surface d'action de brassage (21a, 22a), le papier usagé passant à travers le jeu de brassage étant mis sous pression et brassé par la surface d'action de brassage (21a, 22a), les encres formant des caractères et des motifs sur le papier usagé étant pulvérisées.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 1, dans lequel la machine de brassage (20) comprend un réservoir de brassage (23) comportant un orifice d'alimentation (25) et un orifice de décharge (26), communiquant avec un réservoir d'agitation (10) de la section de macération, les plusieurs éléments de brassage (21, 22) étant agencés de manière à pouvoir effectuer un déplacement relatif dans ce réservoir de brassage (23), et une source d'entraînement (24) pour entraîner le déplacement relatif de ces éléments de brassage (21, 22), la pâte à papier usagé amenée dans l'orifice d'alimentation (25) du réservoir de brassage (23) à partir du réservoir d'agitation (10) étant mise sous pression et brassée par la surface d'action de brassage (21a, 22a) lors de son passage à travers le jeu de brassage des éléments de brassage (21, 22), les encres formant des caractères et des motifs sur le papier usagé étant pulvérisées et ramenées de nouveau vers le réservoir d'agitation (10) à partir de l'orifice de décharge (26) du réservoir de brassage (23).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 2, dans lequel la section de brassage comprend plusieurs machines de brassage (150, 160) ;
l'orifice d'alimentation de la machine de brassage (150, 160), situé au niveau du côté amont supérieur extrême, communiquant avec le réservoir d'agitation (10) de la section de brassage (6), l'orifice de décharge (26) de la machine de brassage (150, 160), situé au niveau du côté aval inférieur extrême, communiquant avec le réservoir d'agitation (10) de la section de macération (6) ; et
les machines de brassage (150, 160), agencées entre les machines de brassage (150, 160) au niveau du côté amont supérieur extrême et du côté aval inférieur extrême comportant des orifices d'alimentation (25) communiquant avec les orifices de décharge (26) des machines de brassage (150, 160) adjacentes au côté amont, et leurs orifices de décharge (26) communiquant avec les orifices d'alimentation (25) des machines de brassage (150, 160) adjacentes au côté aval ; et
la pâte à papier usagé amenée dans l'orifice d'alimentation (25) du réservoir de brassage (23) au niveau du côté amont supérieur extrême à partir du réservoir d'agitation (10), étant mise sous pression et brassée par la surface d'action de brassage tout en passant séquentiellement à travers les jeux de brassage des machines de brassage consécutives (150, 160), et les encres formant des caractères et des motifs sur le papier usagé étant pulvérisées et de nouveau ramenées vers le réservoir d'agitation (10) de la section de macération (6) à partir de l'orifice de décharge (26) du réservoir de brassage (23) au niveau du côté aval inférieur extrême.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 1 à 3, dans lequel la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) est du type à circulation, dans lequel la pâte à papier usagé circule entre la section de macération (6) et la section de brassage (7) dans le cadre d'un laps de temps spécifié.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel l'eau utilisée dans la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) est de l'eau collectée à partir de la section de fabrication de papier (3) après la déshydratation.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel l'unité de macération (6) de la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) englobe un moyen d'agitation (8) pour agiter le papier usagé, et un moyen d'alimentation d'eau (9) pour amener de l'eau vers ce moyen d'agitation (8), le papier usagé amené à partir de l'entrée (10a) de l'enceinte de l'appareil (5) étant agité dans l'eau, avant une macération et un brassage.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 6, dans lequel la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) est agencée au niveau du côté aval du réservoir d'agitation (10) de la section de macération (6), et comporte un moyen d'ajustement de la concentration de la pâte à papier (35) pour ajuster la concentration de la pâte à papier usagé amenée à partir du réservoir d'agitation (10) ; et
ce moyen d'ajustement de la concentration de la pâte à papier (35) englobant un réservoir d'ajustement de la concentration (36) pour stocker la pâte à papier usagé amenée à partir du réservoir d'agitation (10), et un moyen d'alimentation d'eau à ajustement de la concentration, pour amener l'eau vers ce réservoir d'ajustement de la concentration (36), et dans le réservoir d'ajustement de la concentration (36), la concentration de la pâte à papier usagé amenée à partir du réservoir d'agitation (10) étant ajustée par l'eau ajoutée par le moyen d'alimentation d'eau à ajustement de la concentration, une suspension de pâte à papier d'une concentration spécifiée étant ainsi produite.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications précédentes, dans lequel la section de fabrication de papier (3) englobe un transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40) pour fabriquer du papier humide à partir d'une suspension de pâte mélangée composée de pâte à papier usagé et d'eau amenées à partir de la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2), un transporteur à courroie de séchage (42) pour fabriquer du papier recyclé en séchant le papier humide fabriqué et formé dans le transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40), et un rouleau de déshydratation (41) pour comprimer et déshydrater le papier humide au niveau de la jonction entre le transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40) et le transporteur à courroie de séchage (42), et destiné à fabriquer du papier à partir de la suspension de pâte amenée à partir de la section de fabrication de pâtre à papier (2) et à assurer la déshydratation et le séchage.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 8, dans lequel le transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40) comporte une courroie sans fin maillée (45) ayant une largeur spécifiée pour transporter la suspension de pâte à papier au cours de sa fabrication, un moteur d'entraînement (46) pour déplacer et entraîner cette courroie sans fin maillée (45), et un moyen d'alimentation de pâte à papier (47) pour amener la suspension de pâte à papier de la section de fabrication de pâte à papier (2) sur la courroie sans fin maillée (45), ce moyen d'alimentation de la pâte à papier (47) distribuant et amenant la suspension de pâte à papier de manière uniforme sur la surface supérieure de la courroie sans fin maillée (45).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 9, dans lequel, dans le moyen d'alimentation de la pâte à papier (47), la courroie sans fin maillée (45) est agencée de manière oblique vers le haut, vers la direction de circulation, le moyen d'alimentation de la pâte à papier (47) comportant un élément de séparation (79), agencé de manière coulissante au-dessous de la courroie sans fin maillée (45), et un cadre de fabrication de papier (78), agencé de manière coulissante au-dessus de la courroie sans fin maillée (45), la suspension de pâte à papier amenée dans le cadre de fabrication de papier (78) étant diffusée de manière uniforme au-dessus de la courroie sans fin maillée (45) par l'action stagnante, par suite de la coopération du cadre de fabrication de papier (78) et de l'élément de séparation (79), et étant transportée conjointement à la courroie sans fin maillée (45) tout en maintenant la dimension de largeur définie par le cadre de fabrication de papier (78), par suite de l'action de circulation de la courroie sans fin maillée (45), et étant déshydratée par l'action de filtration par gravité par les alvéoles des mailles de la courroie sans fin maillée (45).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon les revendications 8, 9 ou 10, dans lequel le transporteur à courroie de séchage (42) englobe une courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) ayant une largeur spécifiée pour recevoir et transporter le papier humide amené par le transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40), un moteur d'entraînement (96) pour déplacer et entraîner la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95), et une unité de chauffage et de séchage (97) pour chauffer et sécher le papier humide sur la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95), et, au niveau de la position du côté aval du rouleau de déshydratation (41), le papier humide comprimé et déshydraté sur le transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40) est transféré de manière étanche et transporté au-dessous de la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) par la structure à surface lisse de la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 8 à 11, dans lequel le rouleau de déshydratation (41) roule sur et comprime la courroie sans fin maillée (45) du transporteur à bande de fabrication du papier (40) et la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) du transporteur à courroie de séchage (42) à partir des côtés supérieur et inférieur, et comprime et déshydrate le papier humide sur la courroie sans fin maillée (45).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 12, dans lequel le rouleau de déshydratation (41) englobe un rouleau de déshydratation (70) roulant sur la courroie sans fin maillée (45) à partir du côté inférieur, un rouleau de pression (71), roulant sur et pressant la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) ensemble avec le rouleau de déshydratation (70) à partir du côté supérieur, et un moteur d'entraînement (72), pour faire tourner et entraîner les deux rouleaux (70, 71) en coopération, ces deux rouleaux (70, 71) roulant sur et comprimant la courroie sans fin maillée (45) et la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) à partir des côtés supérieur et inférieur, l'humidité contenue dans le papier humide sur la courroie sans fin maillée (45) étant absorbée dans le rouleau de déshydratation (70) par l'intermédiaire de la courroie sans fin maillée (45).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 9, dans lequel, au niveau du côté amont du rouleau de déshydratation (70), un rouleau de déshydratation préliminaire (74) est prévu pour rouler sur la courroie sans fin maillée (45) à partir du côté inférieur.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 11, dans lequel, près de la position du côté amont du rouleau de déshydratation (70), un rouleau anti-pâte liquide (75) est agencé de sorte à rouler sur et à presser la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) à partir du côté supérieur.

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 11, dans lequel, au milieu de la voie de circulation de la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95), un rouleau de finition à surface lisse (103) est agencé de sorte à rouler sur et à presser le papier humide sur la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon la revendication 11, dans lequel l'unité de chauffage et de séchage (97) du transporteur à courroie de séchage (42) englobe une unité de collecte de vapeur (250) pour collecter la vapeur produite par le chauffage et le séchage, cette unité de collecte de vapeur (250) comportant une chambre de collecte de vapeur (252) formée dans le couvercle de l'enceinte de l'appareil (5), et un ventilateur d'évacuation (253) pour évacuer la chambre de collecte de la vapeur (252).

Appareil de recyclage de papier usagé (1) selon l'une quelconque des revendications 8 à 17, dans lequel, dans la section de fabrication de papier (3), la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) du transporteur à courroie de séchage (42) et la courroie sans fin maillée (45) du transporteur à bande de fabrication de papier (40), au niveau du côté amont, sont stratifiées en des couches supérieure et inférieure, et, dans les parties verticales adjacentes de la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) et de la courroie sans fin maillée (45), le rouleau de déshydratation (41) roule sur et comprime la courroie sans fin à surface lisse (95) et la courroie sans fin maillée (45) à partir des côtés supérieur et inférieur.
